stimulusHtml: Is the amount of pollutant increasing at time t = 9? Why or why not?

features.html: The number of gallons, P(t), of a pollutant in a lake changes at the rte P'(t) = 1−3 e −0.2 t MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DF8@ gallons per day, where t is measured in days. There are 50 gallons of the pollutant in the lake at time t = 0. The lake is considered to be safe when it contains 40 gallons or less of pollutant.
